intro: Dichelachne rara, commonly known as the rare grass of the Poaceae family, is a small, perennial grass native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that develop in spikelets. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
